intro: Thysanotus sparteus, commonly known as the Cape jasmine, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are borne in clusters and bloom in late winter to early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Thysanotus sparteus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
